1{-# LANGUAGE FlexibleInstances #-}
2{-# LANGUAGE RecordWildCards #-}
3{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
4
5-- | Attributes of relmap operator.
6
7module Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Attr.Attr
8  ( -- * Attribute layout
9    AttrLayout (..),
10    AttrBranch (..),
11    AttrParaSpec,
12    AttrUsage,
13    attrUsages,
14    attrUsageString,
15  
16    -- * Attribute parameter
17    AttrPara, AttrParaze,
18    attrPara, attrParaBy,
19    maybeSingleHyphen,
20    maybeDoubleHyphen,
21
22    -- * Parse
23    ToAttrLayout (..),
24    parseAttrLayout,
25  ) where
26
27import qualified Data.List                              as Ls
28import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture               as O
29import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base                   as B
30import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Para            as S
31import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.TTree           as S
32import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Attr.AttrName   as S
33import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Pattern         as P
34import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Attr.Message    as Msg
35
36
37-- ----------------------  Attribute layout
38
39-- | Parameter specification for attribute name.
40type AttrParaSpec = S.ParaSpec S.AttrName
41
42-- | Usage text of attribute layout.
43type AttrUsage = String
44
45-- | Attribute layout.
46data AttrLayout = AttrLayout [(Maybe S.ParaTag, AttrBranch)]
47                  deriving (Show)
48
49-- | Single layout.
50data AttrBranch = AttrBranch
51    { attrUsage       :: AttrUsage          -- ^ Usage description
52    , attrParaSpec    :: AttrParaSpec       -- ^ Parameter specification
53    , attrClassifier  :: O.Map S.AttrName   -- ^ Attribute classifier
54    }
55
56instance Show AttrBranch where
57    show AttrBranch {..} = "AttrBranch (" ++ show attrParaSpec ++ ")"
58
59-- | List of attribute usages.
60attrUsages :: AttrLayout -> [AttrUsage]
61attrUsages (AttrLayout ls) = (attrUsage . snd) <$> ls
62
63-- | Concatenated attribute usage.
64attrUsageString :: AttrLayout -> String
65attrUsageString = Ls.intercalate " | " . attrUsages
66
67-- ----------------------  Attribute sorter
68
69-- | Attribute parameter.
70type AttrPara = S.Para S.AttrName S.Tree
71
72-- | Parameterizer for attribute of relmap operator.
73type AttrParaze = [S.Tree] -> B.Ab AttrPara
74
75-- | Parameterize named attributes.
76attrPara :: AttrParaze
77attrPara trees =
78    let p = S.para byHyphen trees
79    in Right $ S.paraNameAdd S.attrNameTrunk (S.paraPos p) p
80
81-- | Parameterize attributes by its layout.
82attrParaBy :: AttrLayout -> AttrParaze
83attrParaBy lay = attrPara B.>=> attrMatch lay
84
85-- | Match parameter with its layout.
86--   See 'paraChoose' in ParaSpec module.
87attrMatch :: AttrLayout -> B.AbMap AttrPara
88attrMatch (AttrLayout branches) p = loop [] branches where
89    loop us [] = Msg.unexpAttrMulti $ reverse us
90    loop us ((tag, b) : bs) =
91        case branch b of
92          (usage, Left unmatch) -> loop ((usage, S.attrNameCode <$> unmatch) : us) bs
93          (_, Right p') -> case tag of
94                             Nothing -> Right p'
95                             Just t  -> Right $ p' { S.paraTags = t : S.paraTags p' }
96
97    branch AttrBranch { attrUsage      = usage
98                      , attrParaSpec   = spec
99                      , attrClassifier = classify } =
100        (usage, S.paraMatch spec $ S.paraNameMapKeys classify p)
101
102
103-- ----------------------  Name
104
105byHyphen :: S.Tree -> Maybe S.AttrName
106byHyphen = fmap S.AttrNormal . maybeSingleHyphen
107
108-- | Take out hyphened text (like @"-x"@) from token tree.
109maybeSingleHyphen :: S.Tree -> Maybe String
110maybeSingleHyphen (P.LAtt1 n) = Just n
111maybeSingleHyphen _           = Nothing
112
113-- | Take out double-hyphened text (like @"--xyz"@) from token tree.
114maybeDoubleHyphen :: S.Tree -> Maybe String
115maybeDoubleHyphen (P.LAtt2 n) = Just n
116maybeDoubleHyphen _           = Nothing
117
118
119-- --------------------------------------------  Parser
120
121-- | Convertible to attribute layout.
122--
123--   * __@-@Word__        — Normal attribute
124--   * __@-@Word@/@__     — Relmap attribute
125--   * __@-@Word@/^@__    — Local relmap attribute
126--
127--   >>> toAttrLayout "-a"
128--   AttrLayout [(Nothing, AttrBranch (
129--     ParaSpec { paraSpecPos = ParaItem 1 [AttrNormal "a"]
130--              , paraSpecReqP = [AttrNormal "a"]
131--              , paraSpecOptP = [], paraSpecReqN = []
132--              , paraSpecOptN = [AttrNormal "@trunk"]
133--              , paraSpecFirst = [], paraSpecLast = [], paraSpecMulti = [] }
134--              ))]
135--
136class ToAttrLayout a where
137    toAttrLayout :: a -> AttrLayout
138
139instance ToAttrLayout AttrLayout where
140    toAttrLayout = id
141
142instance ToAttrLayout String where
143    toAttrLayout = toAttrLayout . B.divide '|'
144
145instance ToAttrLayout [String] where
146    toAttrLayout = toAttrLayout . map addUsage where
147                               addUsage spec = ("", spec)
148
149instance ToAttrLayout [(AttrUsage, String)] where
150    toAttrLayout us =
151        AttrLayout $ map toBranch (S.parseParaSingle O.<$$> us)
152
153toBranch :: (String, (Maybe S.ParaTag, S.ParaSpec String)) -> (Maybe S.ParaTag, AttrBranch)
154toBranch (usage, (tag, spec)) = (tag, attrBranch usage $ trunk $ fmap attrName spec) where
155    trunk spec' = spec' { S.paraSpecOptN = S.attrNameTrunk : S.paraSpecOptN spec' }
156
157-- | Construct attribute branch.
158attrBranch :: String -> AttrParaSpec -> AttrBranch
159attrBranch usage spec = AttrBranch { attrUsage      = usage
160                                   , attrParaSpec   = spec
161                                   , attrClassifier = attrClassify spec }
162
163-- | Set type of attribute name.
164attrClassify :: AttrParaSpec -> O.Map S.AttrName
165attrClassify spec n = n' where
166    n' = case lookup (S.attrNameText n) pairs of
167           Just k  -> k
168           Nothing -> n
169
170    pairs   :: [(String, S.AttrName)]
171    pairs   = map pair $ S.paraSpecNames spec
172    pair k  = (S.attrNameText k, k)
173
174attrName :: String -> S.AttrName
175attrName = name . reverse . unhyphen where
176    name ('^' : '/' : n) = S.AttrRelmapLocal  $ reverse n
177    name ('/' : n)       = S.AttrRelmapNormal $ reverse n
178    name n               = S.AttrNormal       $ reverse n
179
180unhyphen :: O.StringMap
181unhyphen ('-' : n) = n
182unhyphen n         = S.paraBug "no hyphen" n
183
184-- | Parse relmap attribute layout.
185{-# DEPRECATED parseAttrLayout "Use 'toAttrLayout' instead." #-}
186parseAttrLayout :: String -> AttrLayout
187parseAttrLayout = toAttrLayout
188
